transportAdvice: The tourist district along the falls is walkable, with most major attractions concentrated along a riverside corridor served by a local bus system. Taxis and hotel shuttles are readily available, and a seasonal people-mover service operates along the main tourist strip during peak months.

weather.description: Cold and often snowy with freezing temperatures; the falls remain dramatic in winter but outdoor time is limited.
One of the coldest months with frequent snow and icy conditions; crowds are minimal and some attractions may have reduced hours.
Early signs of spring with fluctuating temperatures and a mix of rain and snow; the falls begin to see more mist activity.
Mild and increasingly pleasant with spring blooms; rain is common but the falls are at high flow from snowmelt.
Warm and green with comfortable temperatures; a great time to visit before peak summer crowds arrive.
Warm and humid with occasional thunderstorms; tourist season is in full swing and attractions are busy.
Hot and humid, the peak of summer; expect large crowds, full attraction hours, and frequent afternoon thunderstorms.
Similar to July with warm, humid conditions and high visitor numbers; evenings are pleasant for outdoor dining.
Comfortable fall temperatures with fewer crowds; foliage begins to turn and the atmosphere is relaxed and scenic.
Crisp autumn weather with colorful foliage; a popular shoulder-season visit with mild days and cool nights.
Cool and grey with increasing rain and the first hints of frost; crowds thin significantly and some seasonal attractions close.
Cold with snow likely and festive winter illuminations along the falls; a quieter but atmospheric time to visit.
